div.p: The Belousov-Zhabotinsky (BZ) reaction is the metal-ion catalyzed bromination of malonic acid in acquous acidic media. The concentration oscillations of the catalyst that occured in the IM sulfuric acid aquous solution with 400 mM malonic acid, 57 mM (NH,&Ce(NO& and 60 mMKBrOs have been followed using time-resolving x-ray absorption spectroscopy. The intensity of the white line at the Ce La, edge proved to be mainly sensitive to the 3+ state of the cerium ion and a peak behind to the 4+ state. The optical transmission has been acquired in parallel in order to correlate the colour changes from transparent to yellow with the changes at the Lm edge.
